roleset.name: stock prices, increase
roleset.note: JUMP-V NOTES: Recall from 'rise' and 'gain' etc that arg2 can also be a MNR, as in"jumped sharply". (from jump.01-v)
JUMP-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to jump.01. VN class calibratable_cos-45.6-1. Framed by Katie. (from jump.01-n)

role.descr: end point or end state of arg1

example.text: Cray Research stock jumped $2.875 yesterday to close at $38.

example.name: wow, all args
example.text: a 38 % jump in pretax profit for the first half to # 54.8 million from # 39.8 million on a 63 % rise in sales

example.name: Arg 3 only
example.text: a jump from the rental rates of the late 1970s , when their leases were signed
example.arg: from the rental rates of the late 1970s , when their leases were signed

example.name: With args 1 and 2
example.text: a 5% jump in the Peter's Pence collection

roleset.name: be excited for an opportunity, getting there first
roleset.note: JUMP-V NOTES: Frames file for 'jump' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'increase' (from jump.02-v predicate notes)
JUMP-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to anticipate.01. No Vn class. Framed by Katie. (from jump.02-n)

example.name: opportunity knocks
example.text: Several new funds have jumped to trade at big premiums.

example.name: get a jump on
example.text: So this year , the airlines are getting a jump on holiday discounts .

roleset.name: physically or metaphorically leap, physical motion
roleset.note: JUMP-V NOTES: predicate edited by Arrick (from jump.03-v)
JUMP-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. Corresponds to VNcls run-51.3.2. (from jump.03-n)
JUMPING-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Comparison to jump.03-n. Corresponds to VN class run-51.3.2. Framed by Katie. (from jumping.01-n)

role.descr: entity in motion, if in addition to arg0

example.name: metaphorical
example.text: And what we want *PRO* to do *T* is we-3 do n't want *PRO*-3 to just look at the meterial evidence that we have *T* and immediately make a -- um jumpt to a conclusion that this is a certain individual.

example.name: long jump: arg0, argM-ext
example.text: Jesse Owens set a record with his long jump of 8.13m (26 feet, 8 inches).

example.name: with arg0 and arg2
example.text: A few weeks later, on the very night that Evel Knievel attempted his jump of the Snake River, my platform came the closest to falling again.

example.name: all three
example.text: My jumping the horse over the fence startled the fox.

example.name: use arg 0 for intentional self jumping

roleset.name: to escape, bail out
roleset.note: JUMP-V NOTES: Most examples in this roleset are pretty idiomatic: "jump ship"means to bail out of something, or literally to leave a sinking ship; "jump bail" means to fail to appear incourt after posting bail. These are all being lumped together in oneroleset. Edited by Miriam. (from jump.06-v)

role.descr: entity escaped from (e.g. bail/trail); or idiomatically 'jump ship'

roleset.name: various idioms
roleset.note: JUMP-V NOTES: predicate added by Arrick (from jump.07-v)

example.name: jump the gun
example.text: Now all of these statements by the President and others are jumping the gun.
example.arg: all of these statments by the President and others

example.name: jump the shark
example.text: This TV show has jumped the shark so many times that I don't even notice it any more.
example.arg: so many times that I don't even notice it any more

roleset.name: attack, gangsta style
roleset.note: JUMP-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on Brown. No Vncls. No fully matching comparison (although attack is close-- jump doesn't seem to take the arg1 attribute). (from jump.08-v)

example.name: both args
example.text: `` This deal at Las Putas Buenas where-1 the two knife-men jumped you *T*-1'' , said Rourke with interest , `` that sounds like it was set up with malice aforethought by the luscious Mrs. Peralta , does n't it '' ? ?

roleset.name: opportunity
roleset.note: JUMP_IN-V NOTES: basically the same as "be excited at an opportunity" roleset (from jump.04-v predicate notes)

example.name: knock knock
example.text: People are jumping in now to buy the funds.

roleset.name: rise
roleset.note: JUMP_UP-V NOTES: Jump_up and 'Jump ship' added by Miriam. (from jump.05-v)

example.name: rise quickly
example.text: He jumped up from his seat.
